Package fr.lirmm.chocominer.app.declarative.constraints

Class GeneratorConstraint

java.lang.Object
fr.lirmm.chocominer.app.declarative.constraints.AbstractConstraint
fr.lirmm.chocominer.app.declarative.constraints.GeneratorConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConstraintInterface
public class GeneratorConstraint extends AbstractConstraint
A GeneratorConstraint is a constraint given by the ConstraintFactory in the chocosolver module. Given a transactional database, a double theta and an array of Boolean variables representing the itemset x, it ensures that x is a generator. A generator is where every subset of x has a different frequency that its own.
See Also:
  • ConstraintFactory.generator(TransactionalDatabase, BoolVar[])

  • Method Details

    • postConstraint

      public void postConstraint(AbstractChocoMiningExperience experience)
      Uses the method ConstraintFactory.generator(TransactionalDatabase, BoolVar[]) to create a chocosolver constraint and propagate it in the experience. Only itemsets that are generators will figure as solutions.
      Parameters:
      experience - The experience on which the constraint is applied on.
